name: Association europ√©enne du cautionnement
goal: AECM has 47 member organizations operating in 28 EU countries, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Russia, Serbia, Kosovo and Turkey. Its members are mutual, private sector guarantee schemes as well as public institutions, which are either guarantee funds or Development Banks with a guarantee division. They all have in common the mission of providing loan guarantees for SMEs who have an economically sound project but cannot provide sufficient bankable collateral. At the end of 2017, AECM member organizations had a total guarantee volume in portfolio of over 125.6 Bn EUR and issued a total volume of over  74.2 Bn EUR of new guarantees.
interests: Agriculture, Budget, Business and Industry, Competition, Culture, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, General and Institutional Affairs, International co-operation and development, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market
euInitiatives:
- Banking Supervision (i.e. banking package)
- SME Finance (EU SME Action Programme)
- Agriculture (i.e. next CAP)
- State aid (revision of De Minimis Regulation)
